page.title: 17Lady-in-waiting.
page.content: Lady Hambleden has been chairman of Hambleden School governors since 1948. She is lady-in-waiting to the Queen Mother. On Wednesday,8th May,Lady Hambleden attended the service at Westminster Abbey to commemorate V.E. Day. The purpose of the service was threefold.It stressed reconciliation, gratitude and also hope for the future. The latter was illustrated by the children from the Royal Ballet School who carried posies of white flowers and laid them in the shape of a cross.This showed the world that the youth of today has a part to play in our future.Lady Hambleden spoke of the Queen Mother's love of people, particularly children,of her humility, her love of gardening,interest in racing and her knowledge of television programmes.Her duties can be harrowing when she sees starving people abroad.
